> But, why use j2meUnit then? if you test only the "non midp specific" logic
> you can also relay on JUnit.


- JavaME and JavaSE don't have the same api
- testing on an emulator is not enough, because your application won't 
be used in an emulator

-> you *must* test your application in the environment it will be used. 
     You can use a simulator to ease the testing process but running in 
a simulator is not a proof that the application will still run on the 
J2ME environment.  The final 'Fail/Pass' status will be decided on that 
environment, not on an simulator.

-Vladimir
